lead_paragraph: How bad will it be for students if ITT Educational Services, the troubled for-profit school, fails? Ask the former students of a company called Wilfred.

headline.print_headline: When Student Loans Outlive Failed Schools
headline.main: Woes for ITT, a For-Profit School, Bode Worse for Its Students

snippet: How bad will it be for students if ITT Educational Services, the troubled for-profit school, fails? Ask the former students of a company called Wilfred.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column explains how financial demise of for-profit educational giants leads to headaches for students and taxpayers; discusses implications of possible collapse of ITT, provider of career-oriented programs in 39 states, by describing how shuttering of Wilfred American Educational Corp in 1980s still plagues student loan holders and may soon become issue for taxpayers.
